title: Olivia DeJonge of The Society is cast as Priscilla Presley in Baz Luhrmann's upcoming Elvis biopic
text:
She's best known for her role on Netflix's mystery series The Society and her lead role in M Night Shyamalan's The Visit.

Now Olivia DeJonge has added a prestigious project to her resume Friday with the announcement that she would be playing Priscilla Presley, 74, in an upcoming Elvis biopic, according to Deadline.

The 21–year–old Australian actress will join the previously cast Austin Butler as the King of Rock and Roll.

The big time: Olivia DeJonge, 21, joined the cast of an upcoming Elvis biopic on Friday. The Australian actress will play his ex-wife Priscilla Presley, according to Deadline

Baz Luhrmann, the film's director and the mastermind of musical projects including Moulin Rouge and Strictly Ballroom.

'Olivia is capable of manifesting the complex depth and presence that has made Priscilla Presley an icon in her own right,' he said in a statement.

'She’s an extremely talented young actor and the perfect counterpoint to Austin [Butler]'s Elvis.

The Melbourne-born actress may have come to Luhrmann's attention thanks to her performance in the quasi-Shakespearean series Will, which was created by his longtime writing partner Craig Pearce.

Icon: Olivia, left, will play the young Priscilla, seen October 19 this year

The news of Luhrmann's new biopic comes shortly after Priscilla launched her own Netflix series about her ex-husband.

Netflix announced in August that it would be producing an animated spy series called Agent King.

The show would follow Elvis as he joined a shadowy government agency to combat domestic threats against the United States.

Olivia will likely be playing considerably younger than her 21 years in the film, as Priscilla was only 14 when she first met Elvis.

Stretching herself: Olivia will likely be playing considerably younger than her 21 years in the film, as Priscilla was only 14 when she first met Elvis; shown at their May 1, 1967 wedding

The two were introduced at a house party in Germany, while both he and her father were stationed there in 1959.

Despite her age, the two become inseparable until he left the country the following year.

They resumed their relationship in the US in 1962, though it wasn't until 1967 that they married.

Elvis and Priscilla would go on to welcome daughter Lisa Marie Presley in 1968, before divorcing in 1973.

Elvis would die four years later in 1977 as the result of an enlarged heart and years of abusing prescription drugs.

The new king: Luhrmann's Elvis film already secured its lead with Once Upon A Time In Hollywood actor Austin Butler; pictured July 22

Luhrmann's Elvis film already secured its lead with Once Upon A Time In Hollywood actor Austin Butler.

The boyfriend of Vanessa Hudgens had to go through model music tests and performance workshops in addition to regular auditions to win the role.

He's joined by veteran star Tom Hanks, who'll take on the Svengali-like role of Elvis' longtime manager Colonel Tom Parker.

Parker played an essential role in the singer's initial successes, but also exerted a heavy hand over his private life.

He pushed Elvis to marry Priscilla in 1967 in hopes that it might raise publicity even as young listeners gravitated to bands more in tune with times.

Parker mostly abandoned Elvis later in the 1970s as his commercial potential waned.

Baz Luhrmann's still-untitled Elvis film is expected to be released in October 2021.
description:
Australian actress Olivia DeJonge has been cast to play Priscilla Presley in the upcoming Baz Luhrmann biopic about her ex-husband Elvis. She joins 
Austin Butler and Tom Hanks in the project.
